<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977543865051541625 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977543865051541625><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/493193412045176843/180ce3b2d099537151e2bc4130a018cc.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=philliphenry>PhillHenry</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'977530280564916234')"> I went the other way: Scala to PySpark. I miss writing UDFs that are just JVM bytecode much like the built-in ones. As I understand it, PySpark UDFs pull all the data to the driver by default and execute the bespoke code there. </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(52,152,219) title=jacocal data-user-id=493193412045176843>Jaco</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 9:10‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977543865051541625>5/21/2022 9:10‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>There is pyspark pandas_udf, which does that arrow conversion and stores the function as JVM I believe</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977547409376817213 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977547409376817213><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=philliphenry data-user-id=462278067474137088>PhillHenry</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 9:24‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977547409376817213>5/21/2022 9:24‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I&#39;d heard about Arrow but I don&#39;t think it&#39;s there by default (?)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977609739670290522 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977609739670290522><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 1:32‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977609739670290522>5/21/2022 1:32‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>is it worth it if  you have to always be on the lookout for  new tech, and deal with data all day?</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977609811590021150 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977609811590021150><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 1:32‚ÄØPM">1:32‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>and learning about devops,software engineer,statistics, among other things</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977609869186179073 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977609869186179073><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 1:32‚ÄØPM">1:32‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>and doing the equivalent of three roles</span></div></div></div></div></div>

Sql server is what they are familiar with so it fits their case </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(52,152,219) title=vizbird data-user-id=652318277690982416>vizbird</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 2:36‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977626049972170762>5/21/2022 2:36‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Sql server is fine for apps. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977626160060051466 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977626160060051466><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 2:37‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977626160060051466>5/21/2022 2:37‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Tru dat</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977703996879945768 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977703996879945768><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105378403699408896/6ad9a21f4adaeee654f83a08a1327a68.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=emikachi data-user-id=105378403699408896>emily</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 7:46‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977703996879945768>5/21/2022 7:46‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>modern SQL Server (2016+) has some pretty neat tools for analytics, it&#39;s a very capable RDBMS but comes with a lot of baggage in terms of licensing costs</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977704544152748032 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977704544152748032><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 7:48‚ÄØPM">7:48‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>i&#39;ve built very performant dimensional models in it, with row counts around the ~1bn mark</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977704870159220829 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977704870159220829><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 7:50‚ÄØPM">7:50‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>does that scale to hundreds of billions of rows? probably not, but when your data volume is bounded then you can design with that in mind</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977749766412857374 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977749766412857374><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/293802593988247562/224434e5a6508c2b52d3b4d71566c904.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title="Deleted User">Deleted User</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'977625057469812816')"> Yea connect spark to snowflake </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=johnwane data-user-id=293802593988247562>JohnWane</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 10:48‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977749766412857374>5/21/2022 10:48‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I don‚Äôt think that really leads to any performance gains, at the end of the day, it depends on how much compute you allocate to snowflake (I.e warehouse size) since it is snowflake that is actually executing the query</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977761656727801916 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977761656727801916><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 11:35‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977761656727801916>5/21/2022 11:35‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>it does lead to performance gains since the bottlenecks is our  on-prem infrastructure where most of the cluster is choked up by other processes leading to significant traffic</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 11:38‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977761740228001863 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977761740228001863><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 11:36‚ÄØPM">11:36‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>so snowflake would fix that</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Saturday, May 21, 2022 11:36‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977775224714035261 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977775224714035261><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/293802593988247562/224434e5a6508c2b52d3b4d71566c904.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=johnwane data-user-id=293802593988247562>JohnWane</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:29‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977775224714035261>5/22/2022 12:29‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>If you are running a spark job and it runs a snowflake query, the amount of compute you allocate to the spark cluster is irrelevant, the performance is based on the size of the snowflake warehouse that runs the query</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977777824117190708 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977777824117190708><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:39‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977777824117190708>5/22/2022 12:39‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I don‚Äôt think spark actually send instructions to snowflake. At most it‚Äôll read data from snowflake then part ways</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977777916161179659 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977777916161179659><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/177473204011401216/622bc5b358467b2e000821900158a92d.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=maciam data-user-id=177473204011401216>Mac</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:40‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977777916161179659>5/22/2022 12:40‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>That‚Äôs how I understood it from the docs</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977778015968821268 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977778015968821268><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:40‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977778015968821268>5/22/2022 12:40‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>If It‚Äôs dbt, then yes it‚Äôll be snowflake doing the work</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:40‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977778092401635328 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977778092401635328><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:41‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977778092401635328>5/22/2022 12:41‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>The key point being it‚Äôs a shared cluster. Querying hive runs a Tez job that also utilizes resources and is bad for analysts simply trying to read the data. 

By moving this aspect to snowflake you have now more resources</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:44‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977778301852606495 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977778301852606495><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:41‚ÄØAM">12:41‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>And I‚Äôm pretty sure querying on snowflake will be way faster then hive</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977778673681825882 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977778673681825882><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:43‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977778673681825882>5/22/2022 12:43‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>There‚Äôs a lot of moving parts, but by offloading read/write to external engine can reduce the load on the hive cluster</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-977780458878271559 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977780458878271559><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:50‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-977780458878271559>5/22/2022 12:50‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Adjusting resources on ‚ùÑÔ∏è is also easier then the on prem thing we have</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-977780527111229471 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=977780527111229471><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:50‚ÄØAM">12:50‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Since to scale up   On-prem requires physically buying the things‚Ä¶.</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Sunday, May 22, 2022 12:51‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<a href="https://wiki.cheatengine.org/index.php?title=Assembler">https://wiki.cheatengine.org/index.php?title=Assembler</a></span></div><div class=chatlog__embed><div class="chatlog__embed-color-pill chatlog__embed-color-pill--default"></div><div class=chatlog__embed-content-container><div class=chatlog__embed-content><div class=chatlog__embed-text><div class=chatlog__embed-title><a class=chatlog__embed-title-link href=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainfuck><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">Brainfuck</div></a></div><div class=chatlog__embed-description><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">Brainfuck is an esoteric programming language created in 1993 by Urban M&#252;ller.Notable for its extreme minimalism, the language consists of only eight simple commands, a data pointer and an instruction pointer. While it is fully Turing complete, it is not intended for practical use, but to challenge and amuse programmers. Brainfuck simply require...</div></div></div></div></div></div><div class=chatlog__embed><div class="chatlog__embed-color-pill chatlog__embed-color-pill--default"></div><div class=chatlog__embed-content-container><div class=chatlog__embed-content><div class=chatlog__embed-text><div class=chatlog__embed-title><a class=chatlog__embed-title-link href="https://wiki.cheatengine.org/index.php?title=Assembler"><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">Assembler</div></a></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-978456907306127410 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=978456907306127410><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Monday, May 23, 2022 9:38‚ÄØPM">9:38‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Python and C# languages that are descendants of the C language paradigm of file system oriented, linearly parsed, general purpose multi paradigm languages.</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Monday, May 23, 2022 9:38‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-979139786851897394 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=979139786851897394><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105378403699408896/6ad9a21f4adaeee654f83a08a1327a68.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=emikachi data-user-id=105378403699408896>emily</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, May 25, 2022 6:51‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-979139786851897394>5/25/2022 6:51‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>question:

we have a data supplier and they send us timestamped files multiple times per day, but they have a habit of sending us files with the same filename that they sent prior. these files require some pre-processing before being loadable into any system. the data is all good, but there&#39;s a woopsy with the file name (please ignore these red flags <img
    loading="lazy"
    class="chatlog__emoji "
    alt="üö©"
    title="triangular_flag_on_post"
    src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/1f6a9.svg">).

we want to store these as the canonical copy of the data, <em>ideally</em> without renaming it.

does it make sense to store it like this?
<code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline nohighlight">s3://my-cool-bucket/
  table/
    dt=2022-05-23/  -- (derived from arrival time) 
      ts={unix_timestamp_of_arrival_1}/
        some-cool-file_20220523_1234567890.csv.gz
      ts={unix_timestamp_of_arrival_2}/
        some-cool-file_20220523_1234567890.csv.gz  -- (n.b. same filename)
    dt=2022-05-24/
      ts={unix_timestamp_of_arrival_3}/
        some-cool-file_20220523_1234567890.csv.gz  -- (n.b. same filename)</code></span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-979139986857279539 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=979139986857279539><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Wednesday, May 25, 2022 6:52‚ÄØPM">6:52‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>i don&#39;t generally like nested partitions, and it feels kinda dumb to have one partition per file, but I don&#39;t see a great way around it</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-979140277065371688 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=979140277065371688><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Wednesday, May 25, 2022 6:53‚ÄØPM">6:53‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>the higher level partition serves mainly to provide a unit of work for processing/backfilling</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-979141145550549013 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=979141145550549013><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Wednesday, May 25, 2022 6:57‚ÄØPM">6:57‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>and the subpartition allows a &#39;seek&#39; straight to an individual file, for preprocessing upon arrival</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Wednesday, May 25, 2022 6:57‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

does it make sense to store it like this?
<code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline nohighlight">s3://my-cool-bucket/
  table/
    dt=2022-05-23/  -- (derived from arrival time) 
      ts={unix_timestamp_of_arrival_1}/
        some-cool-file_20220523_1234567890.csv.gz

EMR I believe is more like Synapse where you can run clusters for analytical purposes, not necessarily spark
Glue is a Data Replication tool, you can intelligentlly read most file formats and structure the data itself
Redshift is the DWH for sure</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-979186851216756756 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=979186851216756756><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/5.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=d1ro data-user-id=751471372097814629>d1ro</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, May 25, 2022 9:58‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-979186851216756756>5/25/2022 9:58‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I think it depends. For example, what&#39;s the company business?
What do those 500 employees need?
Assuming GCP, not just Gmail/Drive, what kind of services?

For example, we do a lot of ML stuff by connecting to in house servers simply because it&#39;s cheaper than running on the cloud</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-979760838703480943 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=979760838703480943><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/5.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=d1ro data-user-id=751471372097814629>d1ro</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, May 27, 2022 11:59‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-979760838703480943>5/27/2022 11:59‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Data structures, in the sense of algorithms, are not necessarily queryable.</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-980463001649971311 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=980463001649971311><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/499104423872823298/1a01884db1516a1f0a2fa9a48ed24947.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/270633969031053312/66ecf4034de57e20d5b63fd0b48dd395.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=cd19899>cd19899</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'980428906559590461')"> feel free to message me </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=winenose data-user-id=499104423872823298>Lauri</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 29, 2022 10:29‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-980463001649971311>5/29/2022 10:29‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>If you write to a channel (especially one named &quot;general&quot;) then your message should be clear. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-980479393325522974 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=980479393325522974><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/0.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=leeq1 data-user-id=545932085236465665>leeq1</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 29, 2022 11:35‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-980479393325522974>5/29/2022 11:35‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I have a .Net/C# service that calls an R script every hour. The input is sensor data stored in a time series database and the output is two values that are stored in a time-series-like table in a relational database. However sometimes the sensors are disconnected from the Internet and will send in data with a delay. Sometimes the service/script fails. Both will lead to holes where there is some data that has not been processed. What is a reliable and maintainable way to solve this problem?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-980480762178600980 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=980480762178600980><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/4.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=armslegshandsfeet data-user-id=466248882335252500>armslegshandsfeet</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 29, 2022 11:40‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-980480762178600980>5/29/2022 11:40‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Is your issue that you&#39;re appending / merging into your relational table using the sensor data timestamps?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-980483665949782046 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=980483665949782046><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/4.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=armslegshandsfeet data-user-id=466248882335252500>armslegshandsfeet</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Sunday, May 29, 2022 11:52‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-980483665949782046>5/29/2022 11:52‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Ideally, you&#39;d be writing all sensor data to an append-only store, (optionally) deduplicating, and assigning your processed timestamps from there.</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981166154615771136 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981166154615771136><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/422848788760231947/eb72fe3fc17fd4a2e2e85ee34358f51d.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113128130822021120/0eee50ecf79243635e5cdb858d236296.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=urthor>Urthor</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'981165348495708190')"> then move it to Redshift yes? </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=getbettersoon data-user-id=422848788760231947>GetBetterSoon</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:04‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981166154615771136>5/31/2022 9:04‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>No, the script runs locally, connects to Redshift, moves data from S3 into staging, T and L into final tables.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981167249035493447 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981167249035493447><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113128130822021120/0eee50ecf79243635e5cdb858d236296.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=urthor data-user-id=113128130822021120>Urthor</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:08‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981167249035493447>5/31/2022 9:08‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>sorry ,just on the phone with an airline</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981167789245083658 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981167789245083658><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:10‚ÄØAM">9:10‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve><code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline language-py">def main():
    &quot;&quot;&quot;
     - clean datasets
     - create connection to Redshift
     - drop and create all tables
     - load from S3 to Redshift staging
     - load final tables in Redshift
    &quot;&quot;&quot;
    
    clean_temperature(config)
    clean_energy(config)
    clean_emissions(config)
    

    conn = psycopg2.connect(&#39;user={} password={} host={}\
                            port={} dbname={}&#39;
                            .format(*config[&#39;CLUSTER&#39;].values()))
    cur = conn.cursor()

    execute_tables(cur, conn, execute_table_queries)
    load_staging_tables(cur, conn, copy_table_queries)
    insert_final_tables(cur, conn, insert_table_queries)

    conn.close()


if __name__ == &#39;__main__&#39;:
    main()</code></span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981167819024654336 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981167819024654336><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:10‚ÄØAM">9:10‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>so you call clean_temp first yes?</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981167833444646933 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981167833444646933><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:10‚ÄØAM">9:10‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>and clean temp reads from s3</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981167960041328660 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981167960041328660><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:11‚ÄØAM">9:11‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>then you do a     wr.s3.to_csv(df, 
                 f&quot;s3://{BUCKET}{PREFIX}/&quot;
                 +&quot;clean_GlobalLandTemperaturesByCountry.csv&quot;, index=False)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981167995957178438 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981167995957178438><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:11‚ÄØAM">9:11‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>So you are going S3 to pandas in EC2</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981168144779456563 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981168144779456563><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:11‚ÄØAM">9:11‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I think this is the system design part that&#39;s a bit interesting, but it makes sense once you get your head around it</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981168171476197408 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981168171476197408><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:12‚ÄØAM">9:12‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve><code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline language-py">def clean_temperature(config):
    &quot;&quot;&quot;
     - download dataset from S3, clean and upload to S3
    &quot;&quot;&quot;
    
    df = wr.s3.read_csv(f&quot;s3://gbs-energy/GlobalLandTemperaturesByCountry.csv&quot;)

    # drop columns
    df = df.drop(labels=[&#39;AverageTemperatureUncertainty&#39;], axis=1)

    # convert column names to snake_case
    df = df.rename(columns=str.lower)\
        .rename(columns=({&#39;averagetemperature&#39;:&#39;average_temp&#39;}))

    # correct country names
    df = df.replace(to_replace={
        &#39;Czech Republic&#39;:&#39;Czechia&#39;,
        &#39;Antigua And Barbuda&#39;: &#39;Antigua and Barbuda&#39;,
        &#39;Bosnia And Herzegovina&#39;: &#39;Bosnia and Herzegovina&#39;,
        &quot;C&#244;te D&#39;Ivoire&quot;:&quot;C&#244;te d&#39;Ivoire&quot;,
        &#39;Congo (Democratic Republic Of The)&#39;:\
            &#39;Congo (the Democratic Republic of the)&#39;,
        &#39;Guinea Bissau&#39;:&#39;Guinea-Bissau&#39;,
        &#39;Palestina&#39;: &#39;Palestine&#39;})

    BUCKET = config[&#39;S3&#39;][&#39;BUCKET&#39;]
    PREFIX = config[&#39;S3&#39;][&#39;PREFIX&#39;]
    if PREFIX:
        PREFIX = f&quot;/{PREFIX}&quot;

    wr.s3.to_csv(df, 
                 f&quot;s3://{BUCKET}{PREFIX}/&quot;
                 +&quot;clean_GlobalLandTemperaturesByCountry.csv&quot;, index=False)</code></span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981168247011430453 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981168247011430453><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:12‚ÄØAM">9:12‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>So what happens here is when you call clean temp, you read the data from S3 into the dataframe, you apply transformations, then write back to S3</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981170599915290655 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981170599915290655><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113128130822021120/0eee50ecf79243635e5cdb858d236296.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=urthor data-user-id=113128130822021120>Urthor</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:21‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981170599915290655>5/31/2022 9:21‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class=chatlog__attachment><a href="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/566333122615181333/981170599676223498/IMG_20220531_222126.jpg?ex=68b58fd4&amp;is=68b43e54&amp;hm=5570c6eadd1e4d55a6c8e27397289d11e7fc020867170d0ee1702cab1050c99f&amp;"> <img class=chatlog__attachment-media src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/566333122615181333/981170599676223498/IMG_20220531_222126.jpg?ex=68b58fd4&amp;is=68b43e54&amp;hm=5570c6eadd1e4d55a6c8e27397289d11e7fc020867170d0ee1702cab1050c99f&amp;" alt="Image attachment" title="Image: IMG_20220531_222126.jpg (3.96 MB)" loading=lazy> </a></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981170755515584562 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981170755515584562><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:22‚ÄØAM">9:22‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Anyway, the long and short of it is, a &quot;full&quot; <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981172912788742154 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981172912788742154><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113128130822021120/0eee50ecf79243635e5cdb858d236296.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=urthor data-user-id=113128130822021120>Urthor</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:30‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981172912788742154>5/31/2022 9:30‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>hmm, also you need to login to kaggle to download the data</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981172978790330428 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981172978790330428><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:31‚ÄØAM">9:31‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>it&#39;s not actually that worthwhile to make a launch script I realised, I thought you&#39;d just curl the endpoint</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981173307825090561 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981173307825090561><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:32‚ÄØAM">9:32‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Anyway, I think if you were doing this the fancy way, you&#39;d find a way to read the data straight from the kaggle url into redshift.  But there&#39;s an upper limit at figuring out the fancy Redshift APIs for doing that.

Your app as is is fine, maybe it&#39;d help if you had a go with ansible to launch a VM, then uploaded the data into the VM manually and did stuff.  Because a candidate who can do their own infrastructure as code is an amazing dot point.</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 9:33‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981173716425785345 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981173716425785345><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/422848788760231947/eb72fe3fc17fd4a2e2e85ee34358f51d.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113128130822021120/0eee50ecf79243635e5cdb858d236296.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=urthor>Urthor</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'981173307825090561')"> Anyway, I think if you were doing this the fancy way, you&#39;d find a way to read the data straight from the kaggle url into redshift.  But there&#39;s an upper limit at figuring out the fancy Redshift APIs for doing that.

Your app as is is fine, maybe it&#39;d help if you had a go with ansible to launch a VM, then uploaded the data into the VM manually and did stuff. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981368082150858757 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981368082150858757><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/302132460185976832/9b15b2139263cfce0f7ad0bceafbb010.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=hiphop_com_acai data-user-id=302132460185976832>hiphop_com_acai</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 10:26‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981368082150858757>5/31/2022 10:26‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Why is Spark so popular? Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love Spark, and think its an incredible piece of tech, but i hardly see companies actualy needing it in their transforming layer. Don&#39;t you guys agree that an &quot;modern data stack&quot; approach usualy suits most of the business better? Using an low/no code EL tool to put data into a cloud Data Warehouse and transforming it with DBT. Here in Brazil i see a lot of consulting companies using Spark to process mb of data in a Data Lake approach, i don&#39;t know, for me seens kind of irresponsible.</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 10:30‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981368370958053420 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981368370958053420><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 10:27‚ÄØPM">10:27‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I just like to keep things simple as possible, generaly focusing in what will give more ROI to the company</span></div></div></div></div></div>

class=chatlog__embed-title-link href=https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/cost-center.asp><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">Cost Center Definition</div></a></div><div class=chatlog__embed-description><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">A cost center is a function within an organization that does not directly add to profit, but which still costs an organization money to operate.</div></div></div><div class=chatlog__embed-thumbnail-container><a class=chatlog__embed-thumbnail-link class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Tuesday, May 31, 2022 10:50‚ÄØPM">10:50‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve><div class="chatlog__markdown-quote"><div class="chatlog__markdown-quote-border"></div><div class="chatlog__markdown-quote-content">A cost center is a function within an organization that does not directly add to profit but still costs money to operate, such as the accounting, HR, or IT departments.</div></div></span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981374114533109791 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981374114533109791><div <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981674473600208916 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981674473600208916><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/5.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=d1ro data-user-id=751471372097814629>d1ro</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 1, 2022 6:43‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981674473600208916>6/1/2022 6:43‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Depends on what the actions are, yes.

If it&#39;s modifying an attachment, yes. 
If it&#39;s modifying metadata, no.
If it&#39;s deleting attachments, then you&#39;ll delete and then download/modify/upload the json.

But, it&#39;ll be less data transfer.
And the work will be faster.

No encoding/decoding the data is of course faster for speed.
No base64 encoding (and overhead)

But I am assuming a bunch of things in your operations. 
Not sure what it is all about</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981677640626868304 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981677640626868304><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/543253923700408324/484391addd9f1ccd2ed7d15b2ae72b21.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=tdh1319 data-user-id=543253923700408324>tdh1319</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 1, 2022 6:56‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981677640626868304>6/1/2022 6:56‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Well to sum it up, i have json docs and each document have N attachements of varying formats (xml, xhtml, pdf...)

I want to use spark+delta lake to process and store incoming documents - streaming mode

Processing is actually just creating json document optimized for search, at the end i put it in elasticsearch. Thats why attachements are important to me, their content is important from search perspective.

I also want to store each document in delta lake table so i can reprocess them very fast when for example we change business logic, fix bugs...</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Wednesday, June 1, 2022 6:59‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981677928314196008 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981677928314196008><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Wednesday, June 1, 2022 6:57‚ÄØPM">6:57‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve><span class="chatlog__markdown-mention" title="d1ro">@d1ro</span></span></div></div></div></div></div>

class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>but my approach is generally to just avoid designing yourself into a corner, and this particular EMR Serverless offering has a clear exit route</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981935501588193310 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981935501588193310><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/499104423872823298/1a01884db1516a1f0a2fa9a48ed24947.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105378403699408896/6ad9a21f4adaeee654f83a08a1327a68.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=emikachi>emily</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'981897131797405716')"> but my approach is generally to just avoid designing yourself into a corner, and this particular EMR Serverless offering has a clear exit route </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=winenose data-user-id=499104423872823298>Lauri</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:01‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981935501588193310>6/2/2022 12:01‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>What do you mean by &quot;designing yourself into a corner&quot;?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981937266450645042 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981937266450645042><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:08‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981937266450645042>6/2/2022 12:08‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Probably anything they gravitates to vendor lock-in or something that ties heavily to saas</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981937950407405678 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981937950407405678><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105378403699408896/6ad9a21f4adaeee654f83a08a1327a68.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=emikachi data-user-id=105378403699408896>emily</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:10‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981937950407405678>6/2/2022 12:10‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I mean it in the sense of being careful about what you use so as to not limit your options if/when the architecture gets revised or extended (within reasonable expectations)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981938199603593347 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981938199603593347><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:11‚ÄØPM">12:11‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>which often goes hand-in-hand with good architecture anyway - decoupling, interfaces, etc.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981938522019749988 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981938522019749988><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:13‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981938522019749988>6/2/2022 12:13‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Now that aws also has serverless spark, it‚Äôd be a good exercise to design your spark job such that it doesn‚Äôt require much changes to switch from aws or gcp data proc</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981938722784313344 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981938722784313344><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:13‚ÄØPM">12:13‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Often I hear people who use serverless offerings having a hard time to do tests or dev locally</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981938921783038052 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981938921783038052><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:14‚ÄØPM">12:14‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I remember a seasoned engineer I know. He mentioned that always keep the core logic in plain python as much as possible, since it‚Äôll be easier to port it to different orchestration frameworks</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981939098837217410 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981939098837217410><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/499104423872823298/1a01884db1516a1f0a2fa9a48ed24947.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=winenose data-user-id=499104423872823298>Lauri</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:15‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981939098837217410>6/2/2022 12:15‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I keep hearing the same stuff, but I haven&#39;t met a single person who has actually needed to realize this porting.</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-981939561959665724 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981939561959665724><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:17‚ÄØPM">12:17‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>It seems that the need to port usually happens to stuff that needs to be rewritten anyways</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-981939599272189972 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=981939599272189972><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 12:17‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-981939599272189972>6/2/2022 12:17‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>It‚Äôs kinda my old habit, since I used to distro hop every week <img

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982022143149735956 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982022143149735956><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/4.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=rakkit. data-user-id=209245848960368641>rakkit.</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 5:45‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982022143149735956>6/2/2022 5:45‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I see a bunch of stuff regarding &quot;columnar cloud&quot; as a means of one big table being fine to model for analysis purposes.
I only have access to on-prem SQL Server. Does clustered columnstore function the same? As in is knowledge and application of techniques transferrable.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982025554071019560 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982025554071019560><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105378403699408896/6ad9a21f4adaeee654f83a08a1327a68.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/4.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=rakkit.>rakkit.</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'982022143149735956')"> I see a bunch of stuff regarding &quot;columnar cloud&quot; as a means of one big table being fine to model for analysis purposes.

As in is knowledge and application of techniques transferrable. </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=emikachi data-user-id=105378403699408896>emily</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 5:58‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982025554071019560>6/2/2022 5:58‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>yes there are lots of parallels and a lot of feature parity, even if they are called something else</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982026091327782922 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982026091327782922><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 6:01‚ÄØPM">6:01‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>i worked with SQL Server and columnstore extensively at my last job while i was learning all the cloud stuff to find a new job</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982027516816535582 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982027516816535582><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/4.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=rakkit. data-user-id=209245848960368641>rakkit.</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 6:06‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982027516816535582>6/2/2022 6:06‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Great, that&#39;s useful to know. I&#39;ll dive into how SQL server columnstore works, and obviously cloud based has the benefit of raw power on its side, but I think the concepts still make more sense than the traditional row based methods.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982032932476702830 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982032932476702830><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105378403699408896/6ad9a21f4adaeee654f83a08a1327a68.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=emikachi data-user-id=105378403699408896>emily</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 6:28‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982032932476702830>6/2/2022 6:28‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>if you can understand the contents of the DMVs for columnstore row groups and segments</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982033016526368798 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982033016526368798><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 6:28‚ÄØPM">6:28‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>and partitions, for tables generally</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982033109438566432 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982033109438566432><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/222069360297115648/5990350e4c28af1a8cbb4165552549f2.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=mirage.ragnarok data-user-id=222069360297115648>Mirage / Fluff</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 2, 2022 6:28‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982033109438566432>6/2/2022 6:28‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I thought MS&#39; docs are pretty good for columnstore indices (<a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/indexes/columnstore-indexes-overview?view=sql-server-ver16)">https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/indexes/columnstore-indexes-overview?view=sql-server-ver16)</a></span></div><div class=chatlog__embed><div class="chatlog__embed-color-pill chatlog__embed-color-pill--default"></div><div class=chatlog__embed-content-container><div class=chatlog__embed-content><div class=chatlog__embed-text><div class=chatlog__embed-title><a class=chatlog__embed-title-link href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/indexes/columnstore-indexes-overview?view=sql-server-ver16"><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">Columnstore indexes: Overview - SQL Server</div></a></div><div class=chatlog__embed-description><div class="chatlog__markdown chatlog__markdown-preserve">Columnstore indexes: Overview</div></div></div><div class=chatlog__embed-thumbnail-container><a class=chatlog__embed-thumbnail-link href=https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/8_2StF6hBizSR9fUiWW7z9s8pqSQvUqlJfycyvxgW_4/https/docs.microsoft.com/en-us/media/logos/logo-ms-social.png> <img class=chatlog__embed-thumbnail src=https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/8_2StF6hBizSR9fUiWW7z9s8pqSQvUqlJfycyvxgW_4/https/docs.microsoft.com/en-us/media/logos/logo-ms-social.png alt=Thumbnail loading=lazy> </a></div></div></div></div><div class=chatlog__reactions><div class=chatlog__reaction title=point_up><img class="chatlog__emoji chatlog__emoji--small" alt=‚òùÔ∏è src=https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/261d.svg loading=lazy> <span class=chatlog__reaction-count>2</span></div></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982286483388002334 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982286483388002334><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:15‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982286483388002334>6/3/2022 11:15‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>that&#39;s what ci/cd tools are for</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982286603349286912 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982286603349286912><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:16‚ÄØAM">11:16‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>the selling point is &quot;you can trigger a job if new commits are made, etc&quot;</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982289612493979710 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982289612493979710><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/177473204011401216/622bc5b358467b2e000821900158a92d.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(231,76,60) title=maciam data-user-id=177473204011401216>Mac</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:28‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982289612493979710>6/3/2022 11:28‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>It‚Äôs a pretty big value add</span></div><div class=chatlog__reactions><div class=chatlog__reaction title=point_up><img class="chatlog__emoji chatlog__emoji--small" alt=‚òùÔ∏è src=https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/261d.svg loading=lazy> <span class=chatlog__reaction-count>1</span></div></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982289869156020224 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982289869156020224><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:29‚ÄØAM">11:29‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Automatic testing on PR, deployments on merge to main, etc these are super helpful things to have that will make your development process much better</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982290275965734962 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982290275965734962><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:30‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982290275965734962>6/3/2022 11:30‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Also just a tool to define and enforce expected state, which helps a lot in a growing or changing team. Obviously it just runs test suites or other things folks have made, but it‚Äôll run them on every PR, and in my experience in teams without it people always forget to run stuff locally</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982290292457742366 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982290292457742366><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:30‚ÄØAM">11:30‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Or ‚Äúforget‚Äù</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982290342239948810 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982290342239948810><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/499104423872823298/1a01884db1516a1f0a2fa9a48ed24947.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=winenose data-user-id=499104423872823298>Lauri</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 11:31‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982290342239948810>6/3/2022 11:31‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Thwre is a point though before they become useful - if you have three guys and the environments change all the time then by all means just copy the same script for everyone.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982297843891077160 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982297843891077160><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/184171428025860096/0ae5943cccd807cd19796f05885e56c0.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(52,152,219) title=joe_mama_1963 data-user-id=184171428025860096>Jake</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 12:00‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982297843891077160>6/3/2022 12:00‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>CI/CD to enforce code quality is really good! Prevents having to deal with things that work but are not ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù.
For example,
def examplefunc(a):
    b = a
    return b + 1</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982299464515600424 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982299464515600424><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/493193412045176843/180ce3b2d099537151e2bc4130a018cc.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(52,152,219) title=jacocal data-user-id=493193412045176843>Jaco</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 12:07‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982299464515600424>6/3/2022 12:07‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Also simplifies pull request approval and code management</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982299826286903306 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982299826286903306><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 12:08‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982299826286903306>6/3/2022 12:08‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I‚Äôm not critical of the concept and more critical of cicd  tools  other features  and selling points such as integrations that says they work but have some complication . 

The major selling point of some of these tools is how seamless they are. 
Having to hand write scripts is not the ideal circumstance imo</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 12:09‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982306879822770226 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982306879822770226><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/5.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=d1ro data-user-id=751471372097814629>d1ro</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 12:36‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982306879822770226>6/3/2022 12:36‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>the problem is the other side.

Commit, push and not run tests

The CI/CD workflow I used did database backups, deployed, imported configurations, did database migrations, cleared varnish, cleared CF and then sent a message on slack.
If something failed, then the previous tag would get deployed and everyone pinged to see if database needed to be restored (database migrations rarely edited existing tables)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

# dictionary of lists
dict_a = {&#39;name&#39;:[&quot;aparna&quot;, &quot;pankaj&quot;, &quot;sudhir&quot;, &quot;Geeku&quot;, &quot;hiowda&quot;, &quot;wohdoaihwdio&quot;, &quot;woidhaohfiye&quot;, &quot;wudhaiygwfa&quot;, &quot;oaiwhd&quot;, &quot;golsham&quot;, &#39;Billay&#39;, &#39;kalo&#39;, &#39;changu&#39;],
