@dataclass
class StorageData:
    dict_data : dict
    student_df : pd.core.frame.DataFrame = field(init=False)
    name : [] = field(init=False)
    degree : [] = field(init=False)
    score : [] = field(init=False)
    level : [] = field(init=False)
    room : [] = field(init=False)
    
    def __post_init__(self):
        if pd.notnull(self.dict_data):
            self.student_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(self.dict_data)
        self.name = self.student_df[&#39;name&#39;]
        self.degree = self.student_df[&#39;degree&#39;]
        self.score = self.student_df[&#39;score&#39;]
        self.level = self.student_df[&#39;level&#39;]
        self.room = self.student_df[&#39;room&#39;]</code></span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982354333867860079 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982354333867860079><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:45‚ÄØPM">3:45‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>She&#39;s basically tasked with designing a React front end for displaying the data in a chart or table</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982354619302830110 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982354619302830110><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:46‚ÄØPM">3:46‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Note this class is missing the school, state, and country columns</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982354854422921256 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982354854422921256><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:47‚ÄØPM">3:47‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>My instructor also mentioned to not use pandas dataframes, which also threw me off because how else would i read the data from a csv file?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982355088251179039 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982355088251179039><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:48‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982355088251179039>6/3/2022 3:48‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>You‚Äôre basically recreating what the DF is doing in a dataclass, which isn‚Äôt really what they‚Äôre good for. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982355175723384912 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982355175723384912><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/0.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=rablaze93>Blaze Raiden</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'982354854422921256')"> My instructor also mentioned to not use pandas dataframes, which also threw me off because how else would i read the data from a csv file? </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:48‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982355175723384912>6/3/2022 3:48‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>There are native CSV reading libraries in Python. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982356469720711208 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982356469720711208><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/0.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=i_._i>dean</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'982355175723384912')"> There are native CSV reading libraries in Python. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982357249580208129 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982357249580208129><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:56‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982357249580208129>6/3/2022 3:56‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I‚Äôm not gonna do the homework part, but I would definitely make sure you read the prompt thoroughly and understand it. Using a dataclass like you have there would be unusual IMO, just like using a regular class for that would be. So I hope that‚Äôs not what the prompt is asking <img
    loading="lazy"
    class="chatlog__emoji "
    alt="üòÖ"
    title="sweat_smile"
    src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/1f605.svg"> 

My suggestion would be don‚Äôt think about how to wrap the <em>entire</em> dataset in a dataclass, but to think about how you would classify <em>each row</em> using a dataclass, and then keep using a more suitable data structure for storing the entire dataset</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:57‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982357611628363866 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982357611628363866><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 3:58‚ÄØPM">3:58‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Basically if you were consuming this data, like your classmate is going to have to, what would <em>you</em> want it to look like?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982358376463872012 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982358376463872012><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/0.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=rablaze93 data-user-id=277292825262030858>Blaze Raiden</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:01‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982358376463872012>6/3/2022 4:01‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>So if there was a hierarchy it would be:
country -- state --school 
                        degree &gt; 
                                    name --level -- score -- room</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982359041001005106 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982359041001005106><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:04‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982359041001005106>6/3/2022 4:04‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I guess my take is it seems like more a data modeling exercise than a dataclass one. Dataclasses are implementation details here, as is how you expose this to the front-end. 

In your example above you have a dataframe, what does one row in that dataframe represent?</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982359204503363614 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982359204503363614><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:04‚ÄØPM">4:04‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Or without the dataframe, what does one row in the CSV represent</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982359425077612584 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982359425077612584><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/0.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=rablaze93 data-user-id=277292825262030858>Blaze Raiden</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:05‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982359425077612584>6/3/2022 4:05‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>so one row in the dataframe looks like: 

 <code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline nohighlight">name degree  score level room       school   state country
0         aparna    MBA     90     A  A54       Baruch      NY      US</code></span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982359481340022834 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982359481340022834><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:05‚ÄØPM">4:05‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>the 0 is supposed to be index</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982360066223140886 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982360066223140886><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:08‚ÄØPM">4:08‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>So i know that ^ this in a dataframe would look like 

<code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline language-python">@dataclass
class StudentData:
    name: str 
    degree: str
    score: int
    level: int
    room: str
    school: str
    state : str
    country: str</code>
but is this it?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982360200231129189 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982360200231129189><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:08‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982360200231129189>6/3/2022 4:08‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>yeah that would be my advice. Create a Student dataclass, and load the CSV into a list of those</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:10‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982360336386646136 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982360336386646136><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 4:09‚ÄØPM">4:09‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Again I don‚Äôt know all the prompt details but I think that would be a sensible use of dataclasses here</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-982399727897280583 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982399727897280583><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 6:45‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-982399727897280583>6/3/2022 6:45‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Needs to verify that X number of files have been sent and received by us. 

I‚Äôm not 100% confident about my knowledge of kafka but this is how it works. There is a kafka topic that  that is about these specific files . Kafka processes these messages related to the topic and sends it to the various databases to be processed and loaded like hive or elastic search. 

This kafka consumer will just be added and listen to this topic and as soon as this file is there it will know to trigger these  spark jobs I‚Äôve created to support the platform</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982400040364552203 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982400040364552203><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 6:47‚ÄØPM">6:47‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>And the jobs will be triggered by nifi</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-982400107599257680 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=982400107599257680><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Friday, June 3, 2022 6:47‚ÄØPM">6:47‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Kafka nifi api i think</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983314637904822373 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983314637904822373><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105332965977944064/a3f1c0674bd7d1e2c448aa3431f34fc3.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=julmust data-user-id=105332965977944064>Julmust</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 7:21‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983314637904822373>6/6/2022 7:21‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I&#39;ve had the same problem. I was split between two projects and felt like I wasn&#39;t getting enough done. What&#39;s helped for me is:
1. Explaining to clients and management that every hour I spend in a meeting is an hour I can&#39;t spend on the project. It&#39;s really basic but a lot of people don&#39;t consider that. Which helped decrease the amount of meetings I was in
2. I&#39;m experimenting with how I work on the projects. I did 4 hours on each for a while but found that switching over after 4 hours, as I was in a flow state, was detrimental. So now I do Mon/Wed on project A, Tue/Thurs on B, and then I split Friday 50/50 for final weekly fixes. This also aligns nicely with my standups for the two projects.</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 7:22‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983353835571544074 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983353835571544074><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105332965977944064/a3f1c0674bd7d1e2c448aa3431f34fc3.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/717362476651511929/62fb3f0af6683a924559628d2e6db8fa.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=classicbrew>classic_brew</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'983342622951223337')"> Does anyone have experience with Cloud Function of google cloud? <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983360462638968852 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983360462638968852><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/717362476651511929/62fb3f0af6683a924559628d2e6db8fa.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105332965977944064/a3f1c0674bd7d1e2c448aa3431f34fc3.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=julmust>Julmust</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'983353835571544074')"> I work with GCP, what&#39;s up? </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=classicbrew data-user-id=717362476651511929>classic_brew</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 10:23‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983360462638968852>6/6/2022 10:23‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>So, I wanted help with the triggers created in the cloud Function. So the task is to like whenever the file gets updated or overwriten in the cloud storage at that time the cloud function should get triggred and then logs can be checked for the same.</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 10:23‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983361638214287420 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983361638214287420><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105332965977944064/a3f1c0674bd7d1e2c448aa3431f34fc3.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=julmust data-user-id=105332965977944064>Julmust</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 10:28‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983361638214287420>6/6/2022 10:28‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>In that case, just set google.storage.object.finalize as your trigger value (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/functions/docs/calling/storage#finalize)">https://cloud.google.com/functions/docs/calling/storage#finalize)</a></span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983362543097614456 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983362543097614456><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/717362476651511929/62fb3f0af6683a924559628d2e6db8fa.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=classicbrew data-user-id=717362476651511929>classic_brew</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 10:31‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983362543097614456>6/6/2022 10:31‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>yeah so for google.storage.object.finalize , this would work only when the file is uploaded in the storage bucket. I wanted that  if the file gets updated</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983362820273999923 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983362820273999923><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/105332965977944064/a3f1c0674bd7d1e2c448aa3431f34fc3.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=julmust data-user-id=105332965977944064>Julmust</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Monday, June 6, 2022 10:32‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983362820273999923>6/6/2022 10:32‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>&quot;This event is sent when a new object is created (<strong>or an existing object is overwritten</strong>, and a new generation of that object is created) in the bucket.&quot;

That should take care of it</span></div></div></div></div></div>

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983820651917881455 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983820651917881455><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/925573659349905438/d5bdcadfa68faa78195af5364fa59d96.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/164194099115589632/a_cfaccc726c55509f374a79a9aaeb635c.gif?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=z0k_>z0k</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'983819269299109909')"> I would wager that most people who use GCP do so because of BigQuery </span> <span class=chatlog__reply-edited-timestamp title="Tuesday, June 7, 2022 4:46‚ÄØPM">(edited)</span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=nodamnham data-user-id=925573659349905438>No Ham</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, June 7, 2022 4:52‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983820651917881455>6/7/2022 4:52‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Is that the equivalent of like Azure Synapse Analytics or AWS Redshift then? <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983822072700600361 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983822072700600361><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/164194099115589632/a_cfaccc726c55509f374a79a9aaeb635c.gif?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=z0k_ data-user-id=164194099115589632>z0k</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, June 7, 2022 4:57‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983822072700600361>6/7/2022 4:57‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I don&#39;t do Azure so I can&#39;t speak to synapse.  Redshift isn&#39;t serverless, so you have to manage your nodes/clusters.  BigQuery you pay for the storage and you pay for the compute (separately).  It&#39;s really strong, but it&#39;s really expensive if you&#39;re not careful.  I think this is a fairly good article that describes the differences in models between the two <a href="https://www.integrate.io/blog/redshift-vs-bigquery-comprehensive-guide/">https://www.integrate.io/blog/redshift-vs-bigquery-comprehensive-guide/</a></span></div><div class=chatlog__reactions><div class=chatlog__reaction title=thumbsup><img class="chatlog__emoji chatlog__emoji--small" alt=üëç src=https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/1f44d.svg loading=lazy> <span class=chatlog__reaction-count>1</span></div></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983824919777378384 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983824919777378384><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/925573659349905438/d5bdcadfa68faa78195af5364fa59d96.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/164194099115589632/a_cfaccc726c55509f374a79a9aaeb635c.gif?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=z0k_>z0k</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'983822072700600361')"> I don&#39;t do Azure so I can&#39;t speak to synapse.  Redshift isn&#39;t serverless, so you have to manage your nodes/clusters.  BigQuery you pay for the storage and you pay for the compute (separately).  It&#39;s really strong, but it&#39;s really expensive if you&#39;re not careful.  I think this is a fairly good article that describes the differences in models between the two <a href="https://www.integrate.io/blog/redshift-vs-bigquery-comprehensive-guide/">https://www.integrate.io/blog/redshift-vs-bigquery-comprehensive-guide/</a> </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=nodamnham data-user-id=925573659349905438>No Ham</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, June 7, 2022 5:08‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983824919777378384>6/7/2022 5:08‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Appreciate this! From my understanding it&#39;s like a lambda pay as you go pricing model, but you pay more for the actual query itself rather than the storage of the data</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983825793270546522 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983825793270546522><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/164194099115589632/a_cfaccc726c55509f374a79a9aaeb635c.gif?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/925573659349905438/d5bdcadfa68faa78195af5364fa59d96.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=nodamnham>No Ham</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'983824919777378384')"> Appreciate this! From my understanding it&#39;s like a lambda pay as you go pricing model, but you pay more for the actual query itself rather than the storage of the data </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=z0k_ data-user-id=164194099115589632>z0k</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Tuesday, June 7, 2022 5:12‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983825793270546522>6/7/2022 5:12‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>if that&#39;s how you want to think about it, then sure. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983971221769187359 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983971221769187359><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/164194099115589632/a_cfaccc726c55509f374a79a9aaeb635c.gif?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=z0k_ data-user-id=164194099115589632>z0k</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 2:50‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983971221769187359>6/8/2022 2:50‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>I&#39;d say there are definitely scenarios where you should care about portability, but for the most part - no.</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-983971387939127396 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983971387939127396><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 2:51‚ÄØAM">2:51‚ÄØAM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>migration of data warehousing is not something done on a whim. <div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-983972030498111508 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=983972030498111508><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/161154369763409921/d760257b5ffd16af7a8fa7056574cc51.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(46,204,113) title=kahnwong data-user-id=161154369763409921>kahnwong</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 2:53‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-983972030498111508>6/8/2022 2:53‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Adapting sql for each dialect is not that complex, but migrating your data platform is 

So unless you can justify the move, there‚Äôs no need to worry about sql variations at all</span></div></div></div></div></div>

    loading="lazy"
    class="chatlog__emoji "
    alt="üòÇ"
    title="joy"
    src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/1f602.svg"></span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984108867032055868 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984108867032055868><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/593139411844071437/37eeeab75e0188efe412f546a2b205b1.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=luuwbuh>Luuwbuh</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'984108536466391060')"> Bit of a noob question, what&#39;s so nice about Qualify? <img
    loading="lazy"
    class="chatlog__emoji "
    alt="üòÇ"
    title="joy"
    src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/1f602.svg"> </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 11:57‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984108867032055868>6/8/2022 11:57‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Really nice shorthand way to filter down the results of a window function. It‚Äôs nothing that can‚Äôt be done with a CTE or sub query + a where clause on the outer query, but it‚Äôs way cleaner</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984109069801496576 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984109069801496576><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/593139411844071437/37eeeab75e0188efe412f546a2b205b1.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=luuwbuh data-user-id=593139411844071437>Luuwbuh</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 11:58‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984109069801496576>6/8/2022 11:58‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Oooh okay, I might have a peek at it!</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984113570788823081 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984113570788823081><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/113136451457146880/0275ef289c9e7b6338d7b72e8f4f2fca.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=i_._i data-user-id=113136451457146880>dean</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 12:15‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984113570788823081>6/8/2022 12:15‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>It‚Äôs like HAVING for window functions</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984120123336032356 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984120123336032356><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/349300657494294528/b37fdcad9f46d21773397f85add2a8c1.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(52,152,219) title=ist42 data-user-id=349300657494294528>Ist</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 12:42‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984120123336032356>6/8/2022 12:42‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>It&#39;s a natural extension of the SQL dialect. The next obvious change. I don&#39;t believe it&#39;s part of the ANSI standard yet,  another argument against sticking to pure standard SQL.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984125667417399377 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984125667417399377><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/222069360297115648/5990350e4c28af1a8cbb4165552549f2.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=mirage.ragnarok data-user-id=222069360297115648>Mirage / Fluff</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 1:04‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984125667417399377>6/8/2022 1:04‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>An example: <code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline nohighlight">--Without Qualify : would write like this on SQL Server/Synapse
SELECT ProductName
      ,ProductDesc
FROM (      
        SELECT ProductName
              ,ProductDesc
              ,UpdatedDate
              ,ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ProductName ORDER BY UpdatedDate DESC) AS RowNum
        FROM Products
      ) rk
WHERE rk.RowNum = 1
;

--With Qualify : can write like this on Snowflake
SELECT ProductName
      ,ProductDesc
FROM Products
QUALIFY ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ProductName ORDER BY UpdatedDate DESC) = 1
;</code></span></div><div class=chatlog__reactions><div class=chatlog__reaction title=heavy_plus_sign><img class="chatlog__emoji chatlog__emoji--small" alt=‚ûï src=https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/2795.svg loading=lazy> <span class=chatlog__reaction-count>1</span></div></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984127354542649354 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984127354542649354><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/349300657494294528/b37fdcad9f46d21773397f85add2a8c1.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author style=color:rgb(52,152,219) title=ist42 data-user-id=349300657494294528>Ist</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 1:10‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984127354542649354>6/8/2022 1:10‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Shorter and easier to read/understand.</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-984127819196031076 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984127819196031076><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Wednesday, June 8, 2022 1:12‚ÄØPM">1:12‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>And potentially easier for an optimizer to detect and optimize.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984145688390684733 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984145688390684733><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/593139411844071437/37eeeab75e0188efe412f546a2b205b1.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/222069360297115648/5990350e4c28af1a8cbb4165552549f2.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=mirage.ragnarok>Mirage / Fluff</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'984125667417399377')"> An example: <code class="chatlog__markdown-pre chatlog__markdown-pre--multiline nohighlight">--Without Qualify : would write like this on SQL Server/Synapse

<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984465895948714034 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984465895948714034><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title="Deleted User" data-user-id=456226577798135808>Deleted User</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 9, 2022 11:36‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984465895948714034>6/9/2022 11:36‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Mastering DBT &amp; Airflow is more marketable than mastering Glue &amp; Azure Data Factory?</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984469670121852928 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984469670121852928><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/324358180257923073/74b87d82f7d21932fb043da64336da8c.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src=https://cdn.discordapp.com/embed/avatars/3.png alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title="Deleted User">Deleted User</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'984465895948714034')"> Mastering DBT &amp; Airflow is more marketable than mastering Glue &amp; Azure Data Factory? </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=tuliocg data-user-id=324358180257923073>tuliocg</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 9, 2022 11:50‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984469670121852928>6/9/2022 11:50‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>well, DBT &amp; Airflow can be basically used on top of any cloud provider, Glue and Data Factory are bounded to certain providers, so definitely solutions not bounded to any cloud provider should yield broader possibilities (more marketable in some sense)</span> <span class=chatlog__edited-timestamp title="Thursday, June 9, 2022 11:51‚ÄØAM">(edited)</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984471833476726826 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984471833476726826><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/222069360297115648/5990350e4c28af1a8cbb4165552549f2.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=mirage.ragnarok data-user-id=222069360297115648>Mirage / Fluff</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 9, 2022 11:59‚ÄØAM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984471833476726826>6/9/2022 11:59‚ÄØAM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>Exactly, there&#39;s certain vendor lock-in with Glue or ADF. But still plenty of organizations using Glue/ADF in that you&#39;d still have a lot of opportunities.</span></div></div></div></div></div>
<div class=chatlog__message-group><div id=chatlog__message-container-984473871652651059 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984473871652651059><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__reply-symbol></div><img class=chatlog__avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/324358180257923073/74b87d82f7d21932fb043da64336da8c.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class=chatlog__reply><img class=chatlog__reply-avatar src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/222069360297115648/5990350e4c28af1a8cbb4165552549f2.png?size=512" alt=Avatar loading=lazy><div class=chatlog__reply-author title=mirage.ragnarok>Mirage / Fluff</div><div class=chatlog__reply-content><span class=chatlog__reply-link onclick="scrollToMessage(event,'984471833476726826')"> Exactly, there&#39;s certain vendor lock-in with Glue or ADF. But still plenty of organizations using Glue/ADF in that you&#39;d still have a lot of opportunities. </span></div></div><div class=chatlog__header><span class=chatlog__author title=tuliocg data-user-id=324358180257923073>tuliocg</span> <span class=chatlog__timestamp title="Thursday, June 9, 2022 12:07‚ÄØPM"><a href=#chatlog__message-container-984473871652651059>6/9/2022 12:07‚ÄØPM</a></span></div><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>well put, I think is good to separate in some extent &quot;open-source&quot; products and solutions with cloud lock-in, if you get the gist of the basics, around orchestration, modeling, processing; the tools itself become more an input rather the the ultimate goal of anything that we are doing.</span></div></div></div></div><div id=chatlog__message-container-984474447811600485 class=chatlog__message-container data-message-id=984474447811600485><div class=chatlog__message><div class=chatlog__message-aside><div class=chatlog__short-timestamp title="Thursday, June 9, 2022 12:09‚ÄØPM">12:09‚ÄØPM</div></div><div class=chatlog__message-primary><div class="chatlog__content chatlog__markdown"><span class=chatlog__markdown-preserve>and there are plenty options from different vendors based on your goals, but in general you can&#39;t go wrong getting the gist of the basics and learning how to apply that on a cloud base environment</span></div><div class=chatlog__reactions><div class=chatlog__reaction title=100><img class="chatlog__emoji chatlog__emoji--small" alt=üíØ src=https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/twitter/twemoji@latest/assets/svg/1f4af.svg loading=lazy> <span class=chatlog__reaction-count>2</span></div></div></div></div></div></div>
